intro: Crocodilodes echinacea, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a perennial herb native to North America. It features showy, daisy-like flowers with purple petals and a distinctive central cone made of tubular florets. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces a milky sap that is characteristic of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for native gardens. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
